I am a fairly new player of DBD and got my friends to play as well. It was really fun at first and we got to bond during the pandemic because of it. We all loved it...Until the new update. It became a consensus that the game somehow got harder (especially because we are survivor mains) due to the change in movements (ie. somehow you do everything slower but the killer movements didn't change so that kinda puts us in a bit of a disadvantage). No one really asked for these changes but the devs just went ahead despite the huge backlash even from the test servers. I do not recommend this game as of right now which is a huge contrast from a few months ago where I basically advertised the game for all of my friends to play. I loved this game and I am genuinely sad that the change was very drastic and negative right as my friends and I were getting the hang of it. I will truly miss the old DBD (RIP). Here's to hoping they do something about it (but then again I keep hearing from the DBD community that they never listen to the players so...They even said that we better get used to it 'cause they "can't" (more like won't) change anything in one of their streams :((( (Thinking of abandoning the game tbh.)

Negative changes to the game from the most recent update:
- Wacky hitboxes (At first I thought I was playing sht but turns out hitboxes were messy)
- Movements
- For some reason, I always get stuck in some parts of the map that I never encountered in my 200 hours of gameplay before the update
- The new UI SUCKS, it looks like a bootleg version of DBD turned mobile
- Not as fun anymore tbh

Don't buy this game until the Devs fixes everything they broke. The Devs don't care about their damn playerbase's feedback and break things that have already been "FIXED" in past updates.
EDIT: They fixed the hit boxes again.

A lot less broken then previously when I had left a review. A lot more fun with certain overpowered elements being nerfed or removed. Keys and stretch res still seem to be an issue but apart from that it's okay. Definitely more fun to play with friends than by yourself though 100%. Killer can be infuriating and Survivor feels unfair most of the time but that may be the new skill based MMR system which still feels very janky - like one game I'd vs a god tier Nurse then next game I vs a Baby Doctor??? But with all its downsides (removal of Pinheads voice lines >:C) I'll keep playing it with pals cuz it's fun enough.

The Dev's inability to listen to the players will be the death of such a great game. New HUD is atrocious. New movement animations are disgusting. Change it back or this game will be another great game to fall. One of the only games i could fall back to play and it be basically the same thing every time now its a completely new game and its garbage. Hit boxes are broken beyond belief they have never been worse. You can be 10 feet from the killer and be hit behind a pallet makes since thanks. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS!!! No longer a fun game with the newest update the game is completely broken. Sucks to see another great game killed trying to make the game more user friendly to everyone and especially the console players. I've seen to many great games fall to this and frankly I'm tired of it you have lost my support and I know thousands of others until you fix your trash game.

This game used to be one of my favorite. The recent update has broken it completely for me. The bad killer hit boxes are worse than ever, the range is insane, the pallet hit detection is abysmal, the new character animations are horrible looking and clunky. This game went from buggy and playable to just utterly bad. Don't buy it. Don't play it. The devs don't listen to the community.

Don't think I've played an asymmetric multiplayer game that is less enjoyable. Playing as the killer and hunting down survivors that effectively can do nothing to stop you? Awesome. Had a full wipe against a team of 4 survivors on voice the first time I ever played as killer. Playing as a survivor? Dull, frustrating, feels mostly useless. I swapped through a bunch of different survivors, tried a multitude of perks and concluded the vast majority make little to no difference when it comes to going up against the killer. The game feels intentionally stacked against survivors, perhaps rightly so, since you're putting 4 meatbags with no means of defense up against a serial killer with all sorts of supernatural powers. That being said, when the majority of your in game players are the side that the game is stacked against, it doesn't really make for great gameplay.

Recently I reainstalled the game, thinking "I really miss all the fun chases. Why did I ever stop playing?". Then, within 30 minutes i was reminded - Because of the people playing it and the way it is encouraged to play by the devs. 

Players constantly try to out-shit one another by being as toxic as possible , the ways to win are amazingly unfit for a scary, exciting game, with killers just camping and slugging and survivors running around boxes and spinning around like dumbasses. Above all, devs are famous for disregarding anything the community has to say. 

When playing you will be frustrated and disappointed, even despite evident merit present here. There really is an amazing game somewhere inside this mess, but as is, i can't really recommend it to anyone.

Sure there are bugs, but this is a sandbox game anyways and it's always changing with the updates so you can't expect perfection every update. It's a good game hands down for any horror game genre fans. It has killers and survivors from major motion pictures like Halloween's Mike Myers for example, as well as many others. The game is small scale compared to other free roam horror games... small maps based on fixing generators to escape. It does get routine after a while just fixing gens and I wished they had other game modes to spice up the fun and excitement. Let's not talk about how none of the generators even look remotely like generators and look more like car engines instead. There are some elements that can ruin the enjoyment of the game such as killer behavior such as slugging, camping, and tunneling the same survivor because the killer isn't good enough to chase so they stick to the same person the whole game. There are other things as well but I will let the comment section cover everyone if they want to add anything to 'What ruins the game' for either killer or survivor.

Muy buen juego, aunque aun tiene detallitos, la mayoria de la comunidad es amable, pero siempre te encontraras con esos que les gusta hacer el "tbag" y otras cosas para burlarse. en general es muy buen juego

So after the endless streak of losses as a loser ... or "a survivor" in game's terms - I've switched to killers. "Suddenly" it turned out it's practically impossible to win a match either (despite my killer having a bunch of optimal perks from the anniversary sale). Apparently the game's matchmaking put new people against veterans regardless if you are a new survivor or a new killer. Also this botched matchmaking takes forever - minutes during prime time (with 60k players online!) I've seen much better queue times in games with only 200-500 people online. It seems the whole development team is on auto-pilot and the management doesn't have any idea what's going on? For example, they've declared their recent killer is the first one with the voice (completely ignoring The Plague)

No idea how a low-effort product like this can get so much popularity? But at least it's dirty cheap so maybe you should try it as a killer (there is no fun playing as a loser-survivor)

itz gud

This game was always pretty stupid and buggy but the devs managed to ruin it to a point of being unplayable as survivor. Lag, hitboxes, broken movement and an incompetent UI design have taken what could have been a promising game and made it into a joke. 

All of this is coupled with the fact that the game is so poorly optimized it can crash high end PC components and often causes performance issues during its bootstrap and terminating sequences. 

Save your money and buy something else.
